questions.text: Oligomycins are macrolides created by Streptomyces that can be poisonous to other organisms. Investigator studied the possible mode of action of oligomycin molecule on the experimental rats. Investigator reported death of rats administered with oligomycin. He found ATP synthesis in rats was inhibited. Select the incorrect statement?

options.label: C
options.text: Reduce electron flow through the electron transport chain

options.label: D
options.text: Has no action on F1 subunit of proton channel

questions.correct_answer: B. Activating proton channel, FO subunit
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Activating proton channel, FO subunit

questions.text: Low insulin: Glucagon ratio favor.
All the following are used in TCA cycle except:

A 45-year-old male patient with a history of recurrent muscle weakness during exercise presents to the clinic. Laboratory tests reveal that his muscle cells are unable to utilize glycogen effectively during physical exertion. Further investigation shows a deficiency in an enzyme that converts glycogen to glucose-1-phosphate within muscle tissue. What enzyme deficiency is most likely responsible for this patient's condition?

A 35-year-old woman is in a well-fed state after a high-carbohydrate meal. Given that acetyl-CoA is produced during the breakdown of carbohydrates, which of the following metabolic products is least likely to be synthesized from acetyl-CoA at this time?

A 32-year-old male is referred to the endocrinology clinic after a routine urine test showed the presence of a reducing substance. He has no history of diabetes, and further blood tests reveal normal glucose levels. His family history reveals that his father had a similar condition but was otherwise healthy. The physician suspects a rare metabolic disorder involving the pentose metabolism, known as essential pentosuria. This condition is characterized by the excretion of a specific sugar in the urine due to a defect in a particular enzyme. Which of the following sugars is excreted in the urine of patients with pentosuria?

Two children with genetic issues in fructose metabolism were seen by the same doctor. The parents of the first child were advised to restrict dietary fructose due to health risks. However, the second child’s parents were informed that their child was unlikely to experience any symptoms, despite the presence of fructose in the blood and urine. Based on this information, which enzyme conversion is likely deficient in the second child?
questions.correct_answer: C. Conversion of fructose into fructose-1-phosphate
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Conversion of fructose into fructose-1-phosphate

questions.text: A 35-year-old man with no prior health issues presents to the emergency department with sudden-onset jaundice and dark urine. He reports no recent illnesses but mentions taking an over-the-counter medication for a fever two days ago. His family history indicates that his maternal grandfather experienced a similar episode. A peripheral smear reveals the presence of Heinz bodies. Which enzyme deficiency is most likely associated with this patient's presentation?

A full-term newborn girl was brought to a pediatrician because she was failing to grow and gain weight. A review of her six-month history revealed persistent acidosis that hadn’t improved with thiamine supplementation. On examination, she displayed a small head, low muscle tone, and reduced muscle bulk. Blood tests showed elevated pyruvate levels. Which of the following statements about her condition is incorrect?

options.label: C
options.text: Giving Vitamin B6 will help in her treatment

options.label: D
options.text: Lactate levels increase in the blood

questions.correct_answer: C. Giving Vitamin B6 will help in her treatment
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Giving Vitamin B6 will help in her treatment

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman comes to the clinic with complaints of fatigue and low energy levels. Blood tests reveal elevated blood glucose levels and decreased insulin sensitivity. Upon further investigation, it is noted that there is an increased reliance on anaerobic pathways for energy production in her muscle cells. Which of the following metabolic pathways, occurring exclusively in the cytoplasm, would be most active in her cells under these conditions?
Child is presented with hypoglycemia, hepatomegaly and accumulation of abnormal glycogen on liver biopsy. Most probable diagnosis is?

A biochemist is studying the metabolic pathways involved in the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle and the various substrates that contribute to its intermediates. In the context of amino acid metabolism, the biochemist focuses on aspartate, which is known to participate in transamination reactions and other metabolic processes. Which of the following intermediates of the TCA cycle can be formed from aspartate?

A 50-year-old man is prescribed lactulose to manage his chronic constipation and hepatic encephalopathy. The physician explains that lactulose is a synthetic disaccharide that helps increase osmotic pressure in the colon, promoting bowel movements. Which of the following pairs of monosaccharides make up lactulose?
The man’s brain would attempt to decrease consumption of glucose and increase consumption of ketones in order to protect the breakdown (catabolism) of which one of the following?

A 25-year-old athlete consumes a carbohydrate-rich meal before a workout. During intense exercise, his body needs to rapidly break down glycogen to release glucose for energy. The physician explains that glycogen phosphorylase, the key enzyme in glycogenolysis, is activated to meet the increased energy demands. Which of the following activates glycogen phosphorylase?

A 5-day-old newborn is brought to the clinic with poor feeding, vomiting, lethargy, and seizures. The parents report that the baby's urine has a distinct sweet, "burnt sugar" smell. Laboratory tests reveal elevated levels of leucine, isoleucine, and valine in the blood. The physician suspects a disorder of branched-chain amino acid metabolism. The characteristic burnt sugar smell of urine is due to a defect in which of the following enzymes?

A 17-year-old boy presents with a recurrent history of a red, scaly rash that appears each spring, primarily on sun-exposed areas such as the face, neck, and hands. He also reports intermittent episodes of irritability, confusion, and coordination issues. His diet is balanced and includes an adequate intake of protein and vitamins. Laboratory tests reveal increased excretion of neutral amino acids in the urine, while levels of serotonin and its metabolites, including 5-HIAA, are within the normal range. Urine tests for indole compounds are negative. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient with hepatic encephalopathy presents with elevated ammonia levels in the blood. The physician explains that ammonia is a toxic byproduct of protein metabolism and is transported from the brain to the liver for detoxification. Which of the following amino acids is primarily responsible for this transport process?

A 55-year-old man with a history of hypertension and cardiovascular disease is prescribed a medication that enhances the bioavailability of nitric oxide to help improve blood vessel dilation. The synthesis of nitric oxide in endothelial cells depends on a specific amino acid, which acts as a precursor. Which amino acid is essential for the synthesis of nitric oxide in the body?
A laboratory technician performs electrophoresis using a pH gradient to separate proteins. Which type of electrophoresis technique is being used?

A 42-year-old man presents to the cardiology clinic with complaints of fatigue, palpitations, and occasional chest discomfort. After a thorough evaluation, the cardiologist suspects that the patient may have an underlying metabolic disorder related to amino acid metabolism. The patient’s dietary history reveals that he has been following a restricted diet low in essential amino acid. Which of the following essential amino acid, when metabolically impaired, is most likely to lead to cardiac problems due to its role in the synthesis of key metabolites involved in cardiovascular health?
Guanidinium group is associated with:
Polar amino acids is/are:

A 5-year-old girl is brought to the pediatric clinic with concerns of frequent falls and visual problems. On examination, she displays a tall, thin stature with a high-arched palate, and lens dislocation downwards & inwards is noted in both eyes. Additionally, the child has a history of developmental delay and a predisposition to thromboembolic events. Given these clinical findings, which alteration in amino acid metabolism is most characteristic of the child's likely inherited metabolic disorder?

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the hospital with episodes of irritability, vomiting, and rapid breathing. Laboratory findings indicate elevated ammonia levels in the blood. Citrulline cannot be found in plasma amino acid analysis, however his urinary orotic acid level is elevated. Given the clinical picture and the boy's age, an inherited metabolic disorder is suspected. Which enzyme reaction is most likely affected in this patient's condition?

options.label: C
options.text: Conversion of carbamoyl phosphate to citrulline

questions.correct_answer: C. Conversion of carbamoyl phosphate to citrulline
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Conversion of carbamoyl phosphate to citrulline

questions.text: A patient is diagnosed with a disorder affecting thyroid and adrenal function. The doctor is reviewing the synthesis pathways of thyroxine and catecholamines. Which of the following amino acids is the precursor for both thyroxine and catecholamines?

A child presents with symptoms of eye involvement and skin lesions. Laboratory tests reveal a deficiency in the enzyme responsible for converting tyrosine to phydroxyphenylpyruvate. What enzyme deficiency is most likely causing this condition?
A patient with hepatic dysfunction has an impaired urea cycle. Which of the following statements best describes a correct aspect of the urea cycle?

options.label: A
options.text: The two nitrogen atoms that are incorporated into urea enter the cycle as ammonia and alanine.

options.label: B
options.text: Urea is produced directly by the hydrolysis of ornithine.

options.label: C
options.text: ATP is required for the reaction in which argininosuccinate is cleaved to form arginine.

options.label: D
options.text: Urinary urea is increased by a diet rich in protein.

questions.correct_answer: D. Urinary urea is increased by a diet rich in protein.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Urinary urea is increased by a diet rich in protein.

questions.text: Glycine is not required in synthesis of:

Parents bring in their 2-week-old child fearful that he has ingested a poison. They had delayed disposing one of the child’s diapers and noted a black discoloration where the urine had collected. Later, they realized that all of the child’s diapers would turn black if stored as waste for a day or so. Knowing that phenol groups can complex to form colors, which amino acid pathways are implicated in this phenomenon?

options.label: A
options.text: The phenylalanine, tyrosine, and homogentisate pathway

options.label: C
options.text: The leucine, isoleucine, and valine pathway

questions.correct_answer: A. The phenylalanine, tyrosine, and homogentisate pathway
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The phenylalanine, tyrosine, and homogentisate pathway

questions.text: Amino acids secreted in cystinuria are all except:
Which one of the following statements about protein structure is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Proteins consisting of one polypeptide can have quaternary structure.

options.label: B
options.text: The formation of a disulfide bond in a protein requires that the two participating cysteine residues be adjacent to each other in the primary sequence of the protein.

options.label: C
options.text: The stability of quaternary structure in proteins is mainly a result of covalent bonds among the subunits

options.label: D
options.text: The Information required for the correct folding of a protein is contained in the specific sequences of amino acids along the polypeptide chain.

questions.correct_answer: D. The Information required for the correct folding of a protein is contained in the specific sequences of amino acids along the polypeptide chain.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) The Information required for the correct folding of a protein is contained in the specific sequences of amino acids along the polypeptide chain.

questions.text: Which of the following reaction occur both in mitochondria and cytosol:

A 60-year-old patient with a family history of cardiovascular disease is advised to make dietary changes to reduce their risk of coronary artery disease. Which type of fatty acid is most beneficial for reducing inflammation and improving heart health, potentially lowering the risk of coronary artery disease?

A 23-yr lady has elevated BP on her routine checkup at 8 months gestation, and testing by her obstetrician demonstrates anemia with hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, and low platelets that are characteristic of HELLP syndrome. The female is hospitalized and fetal matu­rity tests are performed that allow elective premature delivery. The female quickly recovers but the premature newborn has a dilated heart and ele­vated liver enzymes that are characteristic of a defect in long chain fatty acid oxidation. The potential enzyme deficiencies are those responsible for sequential oxidation of fatty acids, which include which of the following?
In beta oxidation of palmitic acid net gain of ATP is?
In beta oxidation of palmitic acid if final product is acetoacetate then net gain of ATP is?

A 40-year-old patient presents with symptoms of peripheral neuropathy and mild hepatosplenomegaly. On examination, the tonsils appear notably enlarged and have an orange-yellow hue. Laboratory Investigations reveal a remarkably low level of high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol. Which inherited metabolic disorder is most likely responsible for this clinical presentation?
Which of the following compounds is produced as a result of the oxidation of odd-chain fatty acids during metabolic processes?
Which among the following is considered a key biochemical marker indicative of the process of apoptosis (programmed cell death)?

A 25-year-old male presents after an intense workout. He is interested in understanding which metabolic pathway in his cells generates the most ATP. Based on your knowledge of cellular metabolism, which of the following processes is most efficient in generating ATP?

A patient with a metabolic disorder is unable to oxidize long-chain fatty acids properly. The physician suspects an issue with the transport of these fatty acids into the mitochondria for beta-oxidation. Which of the following molecules facilitates the transport of long-chain fatty acids across the inner mitochondrial membrane?

A patient is undergoing a metabolic evaluation to understand the source of reducing equivalents necessary for fatty acid synthesis. Which of the following pathways is the main source of these reducing equivalents?

Assertion: When the liver is actively synthesizing fatty acids in fed state, there is a concomitant decrease in β oxidation of fatty acids inside the mitochondria Reason: Malonyl coA inhibit CPT-1, present at outer mitochondrial membrane

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and R are wrong

questions.correct_answer: A. A and R both correct and R is explanation of A
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

questions.text: A young patient with a history of recurring attacks of pancreatitis, eruptive xanthomas, normal cholesterol, and increased plasma triglyceride levels (1500 mg/dl) associated with chylomicrons, most likely has a deficiency in:
Enzyme for cholesterol synthesis and ketone body synthesis and beta oxidation of fatty acid?

Male patient of age 18 years reported with symptoms of full body pain, foamy urine, nausea, vomiting, weight loss, and rash over skin of extremities, back and chest. Examination and tests revealed the angiokeratomas, Acro-paresthesia, clouding of the corneas without any effect on vision, deficiency of alpha-galactosidase leading to accumulation of globotriaosylceramide. The findings are supplemented with fig 1 and fig 2. Diagnose the clinical condition.

A 20-year-old patient presents to the hospital with severe pain throughout his body, which is particularly intense following physical activity. He reports frequent episodes of similar pain, and laboratory tests reveal anemia with elongated, sickle-shaped red blood cells. Based on these findings, the patient is diagnosed with sickle cell anemia, a genetic disorder affecting hemoglobin structure. Which of the following statements correctly describes the molecular basis of this disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Valine substituted by glutamate at the 6th position

options.label: B
options.text: Valine substituted by glutamate at the 5th position

options.label: C
options.text: Glutamate substituted by valine at the 5th position

options.label: D
options.text: Glutamate substituted by valine at the 6th position

questions.correct_answer: D. Glutamate substituted by valine at the 6th position
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Glutamate substituted by valine at the 6th position

questions.text: Radiolabelled DNA was allowed to replicate twice in a nonradioactive environment. Which of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: All the strands will have radioactivity

options.label: C
options.text: Half of the DNA will have no radioactivity

options.label: D
options.text: Three-fourth of the DNA replicated will have radioactivity

questions.correct_answer: C. Half of the DNA will have no radioactivity
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Half of the DNA will have no radioactivity

questions.text: Identify the given structure:

A patient presented with unusual genetic anomalies. Upon investigation, it was found that Uracil had been incorporated into the genetic code. This abnormality is linked to the deficiency of Which vitamin ?

While examining mRNA samples from both healthy and affected tissues, a scientist identified an mRNA unique to the diseased tissue. The sequence found in this specific mRNA is AGUCUCA. What would be the sequence of the DNA strand that served as the template during transcription of this mRNA?
SYBR Green dye is commonly used in which of the following molecular biology techniques?
Which proof reading activity is critical in determining the accuracy to nuclear DNA replication ?

options.label: A
options.text: 3’ to 5’ polymerase activity of DNA pol δ

options.label: B
options.text: 3’ to 5’ exonuclease activity of DNA pol γ

options.label: C
options.text: 5’ to 3’ polymerase activity of DNA pol III

options.label: D
options.text: 3’ to 5’ exonuclease activity of DNA pol δ

questions.correct_answer: D. 3’ to 5’ exonuclease activity of DNA pol δ
questions.explanation: Ans. D) 3’ to 5’ exonuclease activity of DNA pol δ

questions.text: The attachment of Eukaryotic mRNA to the ribosome is mediated through_______
The Shine-Dalgarno sequence in bacterial mRNA is ?
A patient with metabolic disorder presents with elevated levels of serum uric acid. Which of the following conditions is most likely to cause this increase?
How do Di-Deoxy nucleotides (For eg. 2’3’ dideoxy ATP) inhibit viral DNA replication by reverse transcriptase?

options.label: A
options.text: The analog becomes covalently bound to the enzyme and inhibits it

options.label: B
options.text: There is no 3’ Hydroxyl group to form the next phosphodiester bond

options.label: C
options.text: The analog can’t form hydrogen bond to DNA template

options.label: D
options.text: Incorporation of the analog initiates rapid degradation of newly synthesized strand

questions.correct_answer: B. There is no 3’ Hydroxyl group to form the next phosphodiester bond
questions.explanation: Ans. B) There is no 3’ Hydroxyl group to form the next phosphodiester bond

questions.text: Assertion: Fidelity of protein translation depends upon Aminoacyl t RNA Synthetase Reason: Aminoacyl t RNA Synthetase has proof reading ability

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and R are wrong

questions.correct_answer: A. A and R both correct and R is explanation of A
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

questions.text: Klenow fragment of prokaryotic DNA polymerase is?

options.label: A
options.text: Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

options.label: B
options.text: Large fragment of DNA Polymerase III, that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

options.label: C
options.text: Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' exonuclease, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' polymerase activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

questions.correct_answer: A. Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

questions.text: Severe combined immunodeficiency disease [SCID] is characterized by a complete lack of cell mediated and humoral immunity. This disorder results from a deficiency in which of the following enzymes?
Methylation of cytosine in gene causes?
A biochemistry student asks why some enzymes are not proteins. Which of the following best explains this phenomenon?

options.label: A
options.text: All enzymes do not follow the Michaelis-Menten hypothesis

options.label: C
options.text: Antibodies take part in the catalysis of many reactions

options.label: D
options.text: Metals are involved in attachment to enzymes catalysts

questions.text: In the given context, which of the following best describes the nature and mechanism of action of inhibitors A and B?
Cofactor for Mitochondrial SOD:

One key regulatory mechanism involves the addition or removal of a phosphate group to or from specific enzymes, which can either activate or inhibit their activity depending on the enzyme. This process is critical in maintaining homeostasis in response to cellular signals like hormones. Which of the following best describes the regulation of enzyme activity through phosphorylation or dephosphorylation?
The enzyme catalyzing this reaction belongs to which class of enzyme?

A 30-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with several concerning symptoms, including dermatitis characterized by red, scaly patches on his skin, a significant loss of appetite, and frequent episodes of diarrhea. On physical examination, the clinician notes alopecia and the patient mentions that he has experienced delayed wound healing after minor injuries. Given this clinical presentation, which of the following nutrient deficiencies is the most likely cause of these symptoms?

A 45-year-old man with a long history of chronic alcoholism presents to the emergency department after experiencing confusion, sweating, and tremors following a night of heavy drinking after a day of strenuous exercise without food intake. Laboratory tests reveal significantly low blood glucose levels, indicating hypoglycemia. The physician explains that alcohol can disrupt normal metabolic processes in the liver, leading to impaired glucose production. Which of the following metabolic pathways is primarily inhibited by alcohol consumption, contributing to the patient's hypoglycemia?
A patient with chronic alcoholism presents with fatigue and muscle weakness due to thiamine deficiency. What is the underlying biochemical cause of the decreased energy generation?

options.label: A
options.text: Decrease activity of alpha-ketoglutarate and pyruvate dehydrogenase

options.label: B
options.text: It is cofactor in oxidative reduction

questions.correct_answer: A. Decrease activity of alpha-ketoglutarate and pyruvate dehydrogenase
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Decrease activity of alpha-ketoglutarate and pyruvate dehydrogenase

questions.text: A patient presented with triad of angular stomatitis, corneal vascularization and glossitis with magenta coloured tongue is probably a case of
Arsenic poisoning inhibit ?

A 16-year-old girl has been on a strict fat-free diet for several weeks in an attempt to lose weight. She is now experiencing various symptoms, including hormonal imbalances. Which of the following would she most likely be deficient in her ability to synthesize due to the lack of dietary fat?

A 45-year-old woman recovering from a respiratory infection began taking high doses of multivitamin supplements on her own to "boost immunity." After a few weeks, she started experiencing unusual symptoms, including tingling and numbness in her hands and feet. Which of the following vitamins, when taken in excess, is most likely responsible for these nerve-related symptoms?

A 2-year-old child presents with failure to thrive, developmental delay, and megaloblastic anemia refractory to folic acid and vitamin B12 supplementation. Urine analysis reveals an increased excretion of orotic acid. Which therapeutic intervention is most effective for this inherited metabolic disorder?
